dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my god. Really? Yeah, no, seriously, Igor Lepekha, he's the Deputy Minister of Internal Affairs in Kazakhstan, right? He's saying teenagers there are, um, victims of sexual crimes after communicating online.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my god. Really? Yeah, no, seriously, Igor Lepekha, he's the Deputy Minister of Internal Affairs in Kazakhstan, right? He's saying teenagers there are, um, victims of sexual crimes after communicating online.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstani teenagers often fall victim to sexual crimes after communicating online, exchanging messages on social networks and messengers. This was reported by Deputy Minister of Internal Affairs Igor Lepekha.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Online? Wow. Like, this is a groundbreaking discovery? People meet online, bad things happen?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Online? Wow. Like, this is a groundbreaking discovery? People meet online, bad things happen?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Well, he's saying "virtual dating" remains a serious problem. And that they need to strengthen digital literacy in students.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, he's saying virtual dating remains a serious problem. And that they need to strengthen digital literacy in students.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "Virtual dating remains another serious problem. Teenagers often become victims of sexual crimes after communicating online, exchanging messages on social networks and messengers," he said during a roundtable discussion in the Senate. In this regard, the Deputy Minister considers it necessary to strengthen work on the formation of digital literacy in students, instilling a culture of safe behavior on the Internet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Digital literacy. Right. So, like, teach kids to... click wisely? What's that even look like?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Digital literacy. Right. So, like, teach kids to... click wisely? What's that even look like?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: No, it's about instilling a culture of safe behavior, you know, on the internet. And it's not just law enforcement, but education, parents, society as a whole.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, it's about instilling a culture of safe behavior, you know, on the internet. And it's not just law enforcement, but education, parents, society as a whole.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Igor Lepekha emphasized that ensuring the safety of children on the Internet should become a priority task not only for law enforcement agencies but also for the education system, parents, and society as a whole.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, so it's everyone's problem except, uh, maybe the platforms making money off this stuff? Convenient.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, so it's everyone's problem except, uh, maybe the platforms making money off this stuff? Convenient.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Well, they are doing something. The Ministry of Internal Affairs, they've identified over 19,000 resources with illegal content.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, they are doing something. The Ministry of Internal Affairs, they've identified over nineteen thousand resources with illegal content.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As part of countering Internet threats, the Ministry of Internal Affairs has already identified more than 19 thousand resources with illegal content, including over 2 thousand with pornographic materials.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Nineteen thousand. So, like, how many are there total then? Sounds like, um, a drop in the ocean.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nineteen thousand. So, like, how many are there total then? Sounds like, um, a drop in the ocean.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: And the Ministry of Culture and Information, they blocked, like, over 8,000 sites through Cyber Surveillance.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the Ministry of Culture and Information, they blocked, like, over eight thousand sites through Cyber Surveillance.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "The Ministry of Culture and Information has blocked more than 8000 such sites through the Cyber Surveillance system," the deputy minister added.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Eight thousand blocked. Yeah, but for every one they block, uh, three more pop up, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Eight thousand blocked. Yeah, but for every one they block, uh, three more pop up, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: They're also urging parents, you know, to pay more attention to who their kids are talking to.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They're also urging parents, you know, to pay more attention to who their kids are talking to.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Law enforcement agencies are calling on parents to pay more attention to who their children communicate with and what they talk about online and to conduct educational work on Internet safety issues.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Ah, the classic "blame the parents" move. Like, they don't already have, uh, enough on their plates.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ah, the classic blame the parents move. Like, they don't already have, uh, enough on their plates.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: But it's important, you know? Keeping kids safe online.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's important, you know? Keeping kids safe online.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Sure, sure. Just, like, why does it always sound like they're just figuring this out?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Sure, sure. Just, like, why does it always sound like they're just figuring this out?
